casebody.data:
THAMES TOWBOAT COMPANY, Libelant Appellee, v. James FIELDS, Respondent Appellee and Andrew W. Mellon, Director General of Railroads, as Agent, under Section 206 of the Transportation Act of 1920, Respondent Impleaded Appellant. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. April 9, 1928. No. 220. Macklin, Brown, Lenahan & Speer, of New York City (Horace L. Cheyney, of New York City, of counsel), for Director General. Leo J. Curren, of New York City (Frank H. Foley, of New York City, of counsel), for James Fields. Park, Mattison & Lynch, of New York City (Samuel Park and Anthony V. Lynch, Jr., both of New York City, of counsel), for libelant appellee.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree (287 F. 155) affirmed.
